question.question_subtype: Select One or More Answer Choices
question.stimulus: This is a stimulus for a test
question.question_stem: Well-chosen __________ add interest and __________ to your writing.

explanations.A: Incorrect. While analogies can add depth, they are not central to creating interest and unity in writing.
explanations.B: Correct! Details add specificity and engagement to writing.
explanations.C: Incorrect. Themes provide overarching ideas but do not inherently add detailed interest.
explanations.D: Incorrect. Examples illustrate points but do not universally add interest and unity.

explanations.E: Incorrect. Clarity improves comprehension but does not necessarily add unity.
explanations.F: Incorrect. Originality makes writing unique but does not inherently provide unity.
explanations.G: Correct! Credibility ensures the content is believable and cohesive.
explanations.H: Incorrect. Fluidity relates to flow but not to unity in the broader sense.

question_details.learning_outcome: Students will apply the principles of sentence unity to evaluate and improve their own writing.
question_details.learning_objective: This question assesses the ability to identify elements that enhance interest and credibility in effective sentence construction.
